CORPORATE EVENTS
Community Fundraisers
Corporate Events
Meetings & Trade Shows
Venue on Lake Lily offers a sophisticated and inspiring meeting space. Overlooking Lake Lily in Maitland, Florida. Our venue provides a picturesque setting that sets the stage for productive and memorable business gatherings — ideal for large and small presentations, focused discussions, brainstorming sessions, collaborative meetings, and trade shows.
We offer versatile indoor facilities that can be customized to suit your specific needs. Whether you prefer a classroom-style setup, theater-style seating, or a more interactive layout, our friendly staff can assist in arranging the space to optimize productivity and comfort.
Large windows provide ample natural light, allowing attendees to enjoy verdant views of the lake and surrounding landscape. The connection to nature not only enhances the aesthetics but also promotes a sense of calm and inspiration, fostering creativity and engagement among participants.
In addition to our meetings, Venue on Lake Lily offers various amenities to enhance your event experience. A dedicated breakout area provides a comfortable and relaxed setting for networking, refreshments, or smaller group discussions. Outdoor areas, such as our lakeside patio, offers a refreshing retreat during breaks, allowing attendees to recharge and appreciate the natural beauty of the surroundings.

POLITICAL EVENTS
Rallies & Meetings
Political Events
Rallies & Meetings
No matter your political affiliation, Venue on Lake Lily empowers small leadership meetings to larger rallies and conferences. Our west wing can handle up to 400+ attendees, our east wing can hold up to 275+ attendees, and even very large events with multiple venue options can be spread out throughout our event halls and the exterior spaces on our campus.

SUPPORT THE VENUE
Support the Venue
We Welcome Your Donations
DONATE SECURELY WITH PAYPAL CHECKOUT
Thank you for your generosity in supporting Venue on Lake Lily. To make your donation quickly and securely use one of the options provided on this page.
Venue on Lake Lily is possibly the only remaining community center of its kind in the nation. Since 1965, the Maitland Civic Center has been a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization with a mission to provide a place where our community can gather and enjoy public, private and secular events, conveniently located in the heart of Central Florida. All funds from venue rentals go to administer and maintain this storied place,
where memories are made.
Leonard “Len” Schmidt
It’s with a sorrowful, broken heart that we, the Board of Directors and Staff of the Venue on Lake Lily – The Maitland Civic Center – share that we recently lost an incredible friend, member of our Board of Directors, Vice President, and a fantastic advocate for the community of Maitland.
Even before his involvement with the Maitland Civic Center, Len was an advocate for the citizens of Maitland. Through his championing the community with various causes, i.e., negotiations with the initial developers of Maitland Center to protect the community’s interests and holding City Leaders through the years accountable to their commitments to us, the community. In addition, he loved the arts and supported other community non-profits such as Performing Arts Matter, Art and History Museums Maitland, and the Maitland Library. When Len joined the Venue’s Board, he continued to champion our community’s multiple interests and, most importantly, help save the Venue during an unforeseen pandemic through his business acumen.
Len was a warrior, and his passing left a great void in many lives. However, he will never be replaced. Instead, Len’s past presence will only inspire new volunteers to our community’s causes.
Rest in peace, our dearest friend. You are missed!
The Board of Directors, Officers, and Staff, Venue on Lake Lily – The Maitland Civic Center
LEONARD SCHMIDT MEMORIAL FUND
In lieu of flowers Len’s family has designated his favorite charity, the Maitland Civic Center, for memorial contributions.
The Maitland Civic Center is now accepting donations in memory of Len Schmidt. The Venue is a non-government owned, privately run 501c3 non-profit community-serving organization.

Chris Raleigh
Sadly, the Officers and Board of Directors of the Venue on Lake Lily – The Maitland Civic Center –share that we recently lost an incredible friend, member, and past director of our board. Most importantly, Chris was the most devoted, loving husband, brother, uncle, and best friend you could ever imagine. He was an amazing talent, an award-winning artist/designer, and a community advocate.
He leaves a void in our lives. We will forever miss him.
Instead of flowers, Chris’ family has designated the Venue on Lake Lily – the Maitland Civic Center, – as their preference for memorial contributions. The Venue is a non-government owned, privately run 501(c)3 non-profit community-serving organization.
CHRIS RALEIGH MEMORIAL FUND
In lieu of flowers, Chris’ family has designated the Venue on Lake Lily – the Maitland Civic Center, as their preference for memorial contributions.
The Maitland Civic Center is now accepting donations in memory of Chris Raleigh. The Venue is a non-government owned, privately run 501c3 non-profit community-serving organization.

ABOUT US
Mission & Venue History
About Us
Mission & Venue History
Our Vision
We continue to be North Orlando and Maitland’s premier events center. Possibly the only remaining community center of its kind in the nation. Since 1965, Venue on Lake Lily (originally incorporated as Maitland Civic Center) has been a Maitland residents grown and supported nonprofit organization with a mission to provide a place where our community can gather and enjoy public, private and secular events, conveniently located in the heart of Central Florida. All funds from venue rentals go to administer and maintain this storied place,
where memories are made.
With a rich history of community engagement, the Venue on Lake Lily is where neighbors come to celebrate, learn, socialize, and, more importantly, make lasting memories. Serving North Orlando and all of Central Florida, We provide facilities for civic, religious, literary, charitable, educational, social and recreational interests of Maitland residents and businesses.
Founded and funded by residents of our community, we are a non-government-owned/supported non-profit that has thrived for decades. As with all places that enjoy rare tenure, The Venue is continuing its journey as a vital member of the community by exploring ways to serve its mission to serve our community.
“The Venue on Lake Lily continues to evolve and become increasingly important as a place where memories are made.” — Renee Charlan
